Based on their message, they seem interested in drama and animation next. Here are two highly acclaimed movies that fit this criteria: 

1. The Shawshank Redemption (Drama) 
   This movie tells the story of a man named Andy Dufresne who is wrongfully convicted of murder and sent to Shawshank State Penitentiary. Over time, he makes friends with other inmates and begins to rebuild his life outside the prison. 

2. The Godfather Part II (Drama) 
   This movie tells the story of the Corleone family's decline from power in the criminal underworld of New York City. The film is divided into three parts: 

1. The Return 
   In this part, Michael Corleone returns to New York City after serving two years in federal prison for tax evasion and organized crime activities. Michael returns home to the Corleone family's mansion at 380 West End Avenue in Midtown Manhattan. Michael's return home signals a new era of power and influence within the Corleone family and in the criminal underworld of New York City. 

In conclusion, both The Shawshank Redemption (Drama) and The Godfather Part II (Drama) are highly acclaimed movies that fit the criteria for drama and animation next.
